definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Requests for interpretation, suggestions for improvement or addenda , or defect reports are welcome.
sentences.chinese: 要求解釋，改良建議或補遺，或瑕疵報告是受歡迎的。

sentences.english: This is an addendum to the book.
sentences.chinese: 文中補遺描述部分腕足類屬種。

sentences.english: This is the supplement to the book.
This is a nice addendum to the 10,000 hour rule.
sentences.chinese: 這，也許是對1萬小時訓練規則的極好補遺。

sentences.english: Verify addendums as noted and information addressed appropriately.
sentences.chinese: 確認補遺及信息已清晰羅列好。

sentences.english: This is an addendum to yesterday's diary entry.

definition: Prime tortoise of the record bureau, Song dynasty historical encyclopedia of political essays, autobiography, memorials and decrees, compiled 1005-1013 under Wang Qinruo 王欽若|王钦若 and Yang Yi 楊億|杨亿, 1000 scrolls
Imperial Readings of the Taiping Era, general Song dynasty encyclopedia compiled during 977-983 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], 1000 scrolls
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
